text: {"grade": 0, "reasoning": "The criterion requires noting that profits of a Brazilian company distributed to a foreign shareholder are *exempt* from Brazilian withholding income tax. The candidate answer explicitly states the standard Brazilian withholding tax rate on dividends distributed to foreign shareholders is 15% (Section III.A.2), although it notes this rate can be reduced by a DTA.
